These things take a beating! I own a plumbing company and I get all kinds of stuff on me. It washes right off. Glue doesn’t but that’s everything.

Several months ago, when I first heard of Truewerk, I was a little skeptical about how they would hold up with the type of fabric they use. I took a gamble and ordered a pair of their pants. I loved how they fit, I loved how they flexed, great pocket layout, and they seemed to hold up. I was happy with my purchase.  Fast forward to summer and warm weather. Obviously I'm gonna order a pair of these shorts because I was happy with the pants.  Well...they almost made it a month before getting ripped. I was under a deck and slid my butt over a rock and ripped a good sized hole in the shorts....truthfully the rock wasn't even sharp. If I had on my carhartts, or my duluth shorts, it never would have been an issue.  That being said, would I order these shorts, or even the pants, again? Ehh, maybe. As everyday wear. Like I said before, I do like a lot of things about them. Would I use them for work? Absolutely not, unless I'm inside doing inside finish work or pricing out jobs.  These pants/shorts are expensive, and I would spend the money if they were going to last, but the durability just isn't there. $80 down the drain.  I will also mention the front of the shorts have started pilling up too. Another sign of the fabric not holding up well.

These are great. I bought 6 pairs of the longer version shorts. I am a master electrician with 20 yrs in the trade. These are almost perfect, better than anything else I've tried. Very durable material, decent breathability in the hot months here in SWFL, great fit. The sharpie pocket and cell phone pocket are used all day every day. I wish the main front pocket openings were larger, it is always hard to get my hands in the pockets. These shorts have also survived many attic journeys with no rips at all from nails, straps, etc. I wear these shorts 5 days a week to work, on the weekends probably half the time, and on long range fishing trips. I would order more right now but I don't need them yet. After 10 months of constant use the only issues are a few small PVC glue stains and the logo lettering on the back pocket tab is wearing off. Please keep making these shorts!

I'm a postal carrier but it takes about 6 months before uniform cards are issued.  With some hot weather approaching, I ordered a pair of these and the Carrhart rugged flex shorts.  These are more than double the price; almost 3 times.  Many of the comments say they run small.  They fit me perfect, but I would say if you have any kind of a belly, go 1 size up.  (Constant walking has caused my belly to disappear).Both have pen pockets, but I like the ones on this better.  I need to carry a marker, a pen, and some kind of knife every day.  The main expense is likely the fabric.  This uses technical fabric which is more lightweight and dries more quickly if it gets wet.  I started the day thinking while it was more comfortable, I would have to consider the price difference.  By the end of walking 6 hours on an 80 degree day, the fabric and price difference was worth it to me.  If you're not going to use them quite that hard, the Carrharts are a good, less expensive alternative.  But for me and how I use, worth the premium.

They are expensive but I already have two pairs of the regular work pants. And now it is summer I prefer shorts. The pants wear well and are very well constructed. These are just the pants but shorter. I'm sure these will last a hard summer and maybe more. Worth the cost.

The pockets are small and difficult to access. The openings on the front pockets are very high in comparison to the belt and are very difficult to get into if you are seated. The pockets are also shallow and don't hold as much as I would like. The side pocket with the zipper is extremely small as well as the RH horizontal zipper pocket. I do like the fabric, it is reasonably soft and seems easy to clean without being too slippery. I bought these for work but I will have to go back to my Wranglers. These shorts will be ok for other uses, so not wasted.
I liked the fact that Mama said my butt looks good in them.

Overall I’m extremely satisfied with these shorts. Like everyone else, I was hesitant to purchase them when I saw the price, but as soon as they arrived I could tell that these guys mean business when it comes to creating good work wear. Comfortable, durable, and the pockets come in handy! The only negative could be the noise they make. It doesn’t bother me at all, but I know that’s a deal breaker for others.

I love these shorts and plan to purchase as many more as I need. I have now also purchased the pant version. I want to wear them all the time.I work for a brewery. Canning, Warehouse & distribution. I take kegs down stairs covered in grease and built in the late 1800s & early 1900s as the bars/reasturaunts are old. I need pants that flex - fit correctly (no long hem - loops sticking out - waist sag) I ordered my size 40 - 30... I can wear without a belt and the hem sits not snug not loose on my boots. I don't catch these on anything. Kegs slide but don't tear on them (I wear them frequently) the legs stretch so I can get down stairs and bend low as needed.  They look good too as they resist stains and dry quickly.  (yeah some days a keg will make you look as you peed😂🤣😳 as it sweats my pants generally are dry by next stop 10-15 minutes saving that look). They are day 1 comfortable unlike others and so far as if not more durable work short/pant. Buy them you will love them. (im 50 so ive owned a few pants too and never felt compelled to write a review for others)

评论概述: Sent back and never got refund
评论详情: I wouldn't like my refund. Too small

i LOVE these shorts. I normally wear Kuhl and TAD Gear shorts and pants. Sadly these Truewerk aren't made in the USA like TAD but they are also not as expensive. They are however on par with Kuhl. Also not made in the USA. Maybe a little less expensive than Kuhl but so far seem just as good. These are my new go to shorts and pants brand.  I also ordered a pair of T2 pants at the same time as these shorts. I was a little disappointed that the waste sizes were not the same fit between the shorts and the pants. The shorts fit like they should have but the pants were a little bigger.  I am 5' 9" tall 160lbs. The 34" waist and 11" length are perfect. A 33 would be ideal but they are great. They sit just at my knees.  As for the noise. Yes they are swooshy. Anyone who wears outdoor technical clothing will be familiar with the noise. It is just the nature of the water repellent fabric.  The pockets are great. I carry my wallet in the leg pocket of all my pants. I do wish the zippered pocket on these had the zipper in the top or the back. Its location on the front is a little awkward for me but that just me and how I sue my pants pockets. It is still very functional. I would also prefer a zipper on the left pocket instead of the velcro. Again, this is just a personal preference.  My other 2 issues are having 2 buttons for closure. Seems over kill but it wouldn't keep me from buying or suggesting them to anyone else. The last issue is the zipper. It could be about an inch longer I think. It is a little short for my liking.  Like everything else, time will tell how long they will last. My TAD Gear lasted me more than a decade. And I wouldnt have replaced them or the shorts if I hadnt lost so much weight.
The fabric on the started pilling after two weeks. They are way too expensive for that to be happening. Not worth the money.

I work in the granite and marble countertop industry. I absolutely LOVE this brand, and the quality that comes with them. I own 5 pairs of the T2 pants. They’ve already outlasted any other work pants I’ve ever bought. They come in at least 5 different colors.  Now that it’s summer, I was wanting to get 5 pairs of shorts. To my utter disappointment, they basically only offer 3 different colors. They have 2 different navy blue’s and two different sand’s (but I can barely see a difference in color between each variation). They don’t have black or the lighter grey like they do with the T2 pants.  I know this is personal preference, but I don’t want to buy 2 of the same color. It’s really disappointing at the lack of color options they have in these shorts. Especially in my size (36x11). It’s the only reason I didn’t give this review 5 stars.

I love the range of movement of these shorts. I’m a bigger guy and really feel comfortable in these shorts. Ordered a 38 but they feel a bit tighter than that. My Walls pants have an elastic and i really wish these shorts had that too.

评论概述: Light but comfortable shorts with a too-short zipper.
评论详情: I would have given these shorts a five star rating if not for the short zipper which completely ruined them for me. Don’t clothing companies test products before they are put on the market? This is a huge defect in an otherwise nice pair of shorts! I don’t know what “work” shorts are supposed to be, but I was surprised at how light and thin the material is, not a heavy duck canvas at all which I had expected for “working” in. Too early for me to say how well they will hold up over time, or how resistant to tears or stains. Even though they are supposed to be an 11 inch inseam, I would have liked a longer inseam, maybe 12 or 13 inches since these come well above my knees. I would also have liked a longer zipper, which I would have expected at this high price point for a pair of shorts. I measured the zipper as four inches and then measured other pants I own and found that most pant zippers are six inches. The loss of two inches of zipper makes these shorts seem cheap and poorly made and awkward to wear. Maybe the company found they could save 25 cents this way, but I’m subtracting four stars for these cheaply made shorts.

They are perfect. The most durable comfortable pair of shorts I have ever owned. I will be buying more. Cons, they stretch out after wearing them. I will be buying the next pair one size smaller.
